name: Hilton Garden Inn Phoenix North Happy Valley

reviews.text: I stayed here multiple times in late 2011.It is the little details that grate..an indifference to customer service at the front desk, waiting forever on the patio for service. I really wanted to like this place, as it is new, clean and convenient to where I need to be in Phoenix, but ultimately I took my custom elsewhere.
reviews.title: Rooms nice, hotel shiny and clean, customer service lacking

reviews.text: Stayed 5 nights here on a business trip and found the hotel to be well located for my needs, quiet (set well back from the road), good service, comfortable room, good happy hour 5-7pm ($2 domestic bottled beers), decent food. Pretty cheap for the standard of accommodation.
reviews.title: Great value hotel in North Phoenix

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wanted to surprise my fiancé with the Hilton Garden's advertised "Romance Package" (see below). However, we didn't feel the love during our stay. The problems began on our arrival, about 8:30pm. Upon entering the hotel lobby, we found no one at the front desk to check us in. Despite ringing the bell on the counter twice, we were standing at the desk for more than 5 minutes before a male and female employee slowly sauntered into the lobby from the direction of the hotel restaurant.
reviews.title: No Romance For This Hotel

reviews.text: I'm standing at the desk, holding a printout of my confirmation, and the female asks without apology, "can I help you?" Anyway, she finds my reservation and says they will set up our romance package immediately. To their credit, by the time I retrieved our bags from the car and located our room, they had delivered a small tray with 6 chocolate-dipped strawberries and a chilled bottle of Mondavi white zin.
reviews.title: good place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The strawberries were delicious. However, the wine was NOT the romantic bottle of "sparkling wine" I expected. It also wouldn't have been our wine of choice, had we known we were getting wine instead of the advertised sparkling wine.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in North Phoenix
Nice convenient location
reviews.text: Stayed here 10/15/12 overnight for business. Took hotel shuttle from airport. Rooms are nice, large, and clean. Front desk was very helpful. It was a treat to receive a bag of goodies, water, and a $2 voucher to use in the market. This is a specific property amenity which I thought was a nice touch. The lobby is redone like the newer ones, but don't let that sway you. We were about 8 minutes from Scotsdale and 5 from the airport.

I stayed here for one night while in town for business. This is a newer hotel and it's clean, bright and comfortable. There is a small bar area and restaurant seating where you can order more than just breakfast. I ordered a spinach salad with chicken which was excellently prepared. There is also a nice casual couch seating area near a fireplace by the front desk. I missed the nightly cookies because I arrived later, but that's a nice touch.
reviews.title: Great hotel - very positive experience

reviews.text: The rooms are very nice. Big, roomy with blackout shades, flat panel TV, desk and closet. The bathroom is also nicely sized. The strange part is the bathroom door opens right into the space of the front door, but that's not such a big deal in the scheme of things. The bed is very comfortable.
reviews.title: Nice new hotel / Great staff

reviews.text: I peeked my head in the gym - it looked clean and nicely equipped. The business center had computers and printers for use. I didn't get a chance to view the pool.
reviews.title: Great hotel with awesome staff

reviews.text: Make sure you get a coupon for breakfast or else they will charge you. They had a nice selection - omelets/eggs/bacon to order, oatmeal, cereal, juices, coffee- definitely above your standard continental breakfast.
reviews.title: A convenient overnight location on the way to or from the Grand Canyon

reviews.text: The breakfast was fantastic with great service as you could order a la carte or serve yourself at the buffet. Great way to start the day. When we reserved online, the price with breakfast was the same as the price without breakfast so definitely take the breakfast. It was $10.99 each for the buffet.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: My only negative comment about the hotel was the pricing at the bar. I ordered 1 (regular Bud) beer and 2 Bailey's on the rocks and the bill was over $21 (plus tip). The Bailey's were $6 each and they seem to treat the 'rocks' as a mix since they charged $1.50 more for each drink. It is the first time I have had to pay for ice in a drink since a trip to Paris in 1991.
reviews.title: Very good hotel!

reviews.text: This is one of the nicest HGI I have stayed in. Great design and very friendly staff. I stayed here for business and would stay here the next time I'm in the area.
reviews.title: Love this place!

reviews.text: Business required a stay in north Phoenix at the Hilton Garden Inn North Happy Valley. Arrival was most cheerful despite the late hour. Room was exceptionally clean. The king size bed actually firm! The complimentary breakfast was cooked to order, healthy and quick. This was my first stay at a Hilton Garden Inn. I will be back and recommend this property.
reviews.title: Friendly and great service in North Phoenix!
hi
reviews.text: great site will use again. Needed to find a great hotel with a great price and found one thanks to this site.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend getaway for our anniversary. We live in the Phoenix area and were doing a sunrise hot air ballon ride in this part of Phoenix, so we decided to make a weekend out of it.
reviews.title: Relaxing stay

reviews.text: The hotel was nice, the room was clean and looks just like the pics on here. The bed was comfortable. We had a king bed in our room. There was also a desk/desk chair, arm chair w/ foot stool, microwave, small refrig, and flat panel TV. The bathroom was roomy, there is no tub (ok with me), and the shower is tiled in with a glass door. There was only one odd thing about the bathroom, the toilet paper holder was located under the sink (mounted there), so you had to lean over and look for them. It was just very odd spot. I guess they did it to not put a hole in the granite sink.
reviews.title: Nice Place to start vacation to Grand Canyon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area is small, but adequate. The pool is heated. They do have a restaurant on site, but we didn't eat there. There is a nice little patio area with a gas fire place also. Good for sitting outside in the evening. The fitness room had nicer equipment in it. We didn't use the business center, but it looked adequate. They do have free wifi.
reviews.title: Nice hotel. Should be for the price.

reviews.text: The staff we friendly, however we did have one issue. We booked our first night on Expedia, then added two additional nights (through Expedia again) for a total of 3 nights. We asked on checkin to make sure they were all linked so we didn't have to check in and out or move rooms. We checked in around 6p for the first night and that person said that it was taken care of, but check with the front desk in the morning. I spoke with the front desk the next morning, and we weren't linked. They had to issue us new keys and said we were taken care of. The next day, we were locked out of our room and had to visit the front desk again and ended up with yet another set of keys. They said they had called us to leave us a msg, to let us know, but there was no msg. Plus it should have already been taken care one of the other two times we spoke with them about it. They were very friendly the whole time, it was just a minor inconvenience that should have been pretty simple to take care of in the first place.
reviews.title: Reservations do not guarantee you a room!
Great Stay and Wonderful staff!
reviews.text: The hotel seems like it's in the middle of nothing, but there are tons of places to eat very close. Also a nice outdoor mall with a movie theater. Overall we enjoyed our weekend and would stay here again.

Nice new beautiful hotel . Check-in was a breeze . We had a room with 2 beds .Usual HGI room with fridge and microwave . We paid for Bed and Breakfast rate @ $ 10.95 each and it was well worth it ./Fully cooked to order breakfast .I had a lovely Omelette .There was everything else you would expect and the service was great . We sat outside on the patio with our coffee afterwards ,such a lovely place . We also used the pool before we left which had plenty of loungers and umbrellas .
reviews.title: Beautiful Hilton

reviews.text: Just a few minutes away from all the shops aT Happy Valley with lots of restaurants .Close to the I- 17 too . We will be back when we pass thro next year.
reviews.title: One of the best I've stayed at

reviews.text: It's a newer hotel, so the condition is spectacular. Room was very nice, the king bed is awesome. Teh Great American bistro is great. The food is very good and the service is quick and friendly. Check in was a breeze. The pool is very nice, but I never saw anyone in it. I dedcided to go in at 10pm and it was great. Parking is fantastic and it's super easy to get to.
reviews.title: A really pleasant hotel in every respect, Hilton at its best...

reviews.text: Cons- the AC can be a little loud when it turns on- to the point it wakes you up.
reviews.title: Nice newer hotel; not much else in the area

reviews.text: I've now stayed at this hotel about a half a dozen times. It's very close to Phoenix Deer Valley Airport (only about a 5 minute drive away), and also very close to the big Honeywell facility.
reviews.title: Missing the Little Things....

reviews.text: Front desk was very accommodating on check in to my particular room preferences. The room is comfortable, not up the luxary standard, but definately comfortable enough for a three night stay on a business trip. The location is convenient to a lot of businesses in the area and there are a great many restuarants of mid-price range within a mile or two, so dinner can be had locally and reasonalby. There is a full service breakfast at the hotel, one day the service and food were spot on, the next day they were way off. Overall, I'll stay here again when I return to the area on business. Rooms were average cleanliness.
reviews.title: A good option in the Deer Valley area

reviews.text: this hotel is located only 20 miles north of Phoenix. Easy access off I-17. We stayed one night, late arrival, on our way to Sedona. Great value for the price. New property. Staff very helpful.
reviews.title: Great Value ... new property !

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Phoenix North Happy Valley Hotel
